entry.title: It's been more than a year since Aurora Police killed...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

It's been more than a year since Aurora Police killed Elijah McClain, and prosecutors have yet to issue an indictment against the officers who took his life. But yesterday, DA's issued a heavy-handed indictment against activists. This is not justice. Read our full statement here: https://aclu-co.org/aclu-of-colorado-statement-on-aurora-p…/

DENVER – The following is a statement from ACLU of Colorado Interim Executive Director, Stephen Meswarb. “Yesterday, prosecutors issued a more than 30-page indictment against activists protesting the killing of Elijah McClain and systemic racism by the Aurora Police Department. … Continue read...

aclu-co.org

ACLU of Colorado Statement on Aurora Protester Arrests | ACLU of Colorado

DENVER – The following is a statement from ACLU of Colorado Interim Executive Director, Stephen Meswarb. “Yesterday, prosecutors issued a more than 30-page indictment against activists protesting the killing of Elijah McClain and systemic racism by the Aurora Police Department. … Continue read...DENVER – The following is a statement from ACLU of Colorado Interim Executive Director, Stephen Meswarb. “Yesterday, prosecutors issued a more than 30-page indictment against activists protesting the killing of Elijah McClain and systemic racism by the Aurora Police Department. … Continue read...

entry.title: “The unjustified killing of Elijah McClain by Aurora police is...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

“The unjustified killing of Elijah McClain by Aurora police is part of an ugly and long-standing pattern of racially biased policing in that city. In case after case after case, Aurora police unnecessarily escalate tension, fear and violence when interacting with people of color,” says Mark Silverstein, ACLU Colorado Legal Director.

Suburban policing accounts for a disproportionate amount of violence against people of color, with officers rarely punished.

news.yahoo.com

The killing of Elijah McClain and the silent crisis of racism in suburban policing

Suburban policing accounts for a disproportionate amount of violence against people of color, with officers rarely punished.Suburban policing accounts for a disproportionate amount of violence against people of color, with officers rarely punished.

entry.title: We are excited to announce Nathaniel Rateliff as our musical...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

We are excited to announce Nathaniel Rateliff as our musical guest for this year's Bill of Rights Event! As an outspoken critic of Greenwood Village's resolution to undermine Colorado's recently passed police accountability bill, Rateliff has promised he will not perform at the city's Fiddler's Green amphitheater until the resolution is reversed.

To hear directly from Nathaniel Rateliff, join us on Thursday, October 1, 2020.

RSVP at: http://bit.ly/2020breRSVP

entry.content:

The Denver Post has ENDORSED YES on Prop. 113!!

entry.title: “I’m voting No On 115 because choice is not optional.” –...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

“I’m voting No On 115 because choice is not optional.” – Hunter Ridgeway

Colorado is one of the few states left in the country where reproductive healthcare decisions are left to a pregnant person and their healthcare provider. This is just the latest attempt to ban abortion access in our state.

Tell us why You are voting #NoOn115.

entry.title: "Prop 115 is the fourth attempt to restrict access to...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

"Prop 115 is the fourth attempt to restrict access to abortion in Colorado in recent years. Efforts in 2008, 2010 and 2014 all failed." This must too. Join our pledge to vote No On 115: http://voteno115.com/pledge

A group opposing Colorado’s latest anti-abortion proposal launched its website Wednesday with an infusion of big-name backers, including feminist Gloria Steinem and civil rights activist Dolores Huerta.

gazette.com

Opponents of Colorado abortion ballot measure launch campaign with endorsements, fund-raising advantage

A group opposing Colorado’s latest anti-abortion proposal launched its website Wednesday with an infusion of big-name backers, including feminist Gloria Steinem and civil rights activist Dolores Huerta.A group opposing Colorado’s latest anti-abortion proposal launched its website Wednesday with an infusion of big-name backers, including feminist Gloria Steinem and civil rights activist Dolores Huerta.

entry.title: Clark, a 9 year-old transgender Colorado student talks about...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Clark, a 9 year-old transgender Colorado student talks about knowing she was trans from a young age and bravely navigating her identity through a world full of gender expectations and a lack of understanding of what it means to be transgender.

entry.title: “I’m voting No on Proposition 115 because abortion was...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

“I’m voting No on Proposition 115 because abortion was banned when I was a young woman. I know personally what a difficult decision it is and that decision should be made by the woman herself with her family and her doctor and her faith in mind. I urge you to vote No on Proposition 115.” VOTE #NoOn115.
@access4allco

entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Tomorrow at 4 p.m., join Colorado Freedom Fund, Denver DSA, Colorado Working Families Party and ACLU of Colorado for a powerful training and discussion on what it could look like if we stopped over investing in police and started reinvesting in community.

WED, SEP 2

Defunding the Police 101

entry.title: 16,000 people could have been safely released under Governor...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

16,000 people could have been safely released under Governor Jared Polis' executive order, but less than 300 were let out before key parts of the order expired. There's no partial credit in a pandemic. The Governor must act today if he's serious about saving lives.

Close to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.

westword.com

Advocates Urging Colorado to Release Medically Vulnerable Prisoners

Close to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.Close to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.

entry.title: TODAY: It's Decarceration Day of Action! Tell Governor...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

TODAY: It's Decarceration Day of Action! Tell Governor Jared Polis to use his powers NOW and bring our neighbors home. Use this toolkit to call, email & contact the Governor on social media: https://bit.ly/3b2A1lC

Remind him that redemption is real. Clemency is courage.

entry.title: Anthony Martinez is an 84-year-old grandfather suffering from...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Anthony Martinez is an 84-year-old grandfather suffering from renal failure, as well as other serious medical conditions including dementia. He is currently incarcerated in the Sterling Correctional Facility, site of one of Colorado’s largest COVID-19 outbreaks with almost 600 active COVID-19 cases. He and his family are understandably terrified that he will catch the virus and die.

In the midst of this public health crisis, incarcerated people as vulnerable as Anthony, could and should be immediately released to safely live out their remaining years with family.

entry.title: Ronald Johnson is pre-diabetic, suffers from asthma and high...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Ronald Johnson is pre-diabetic, suffers from asthma and high blood pressure, and regularly uses an inhaler to breathe. His age and respiratory ailments put him at risk of serious illness and death if he contracts COVID-19. With over hundreds of active cases in Colorado’s prisons, his family fears he will not make it out alive. His daughter, Amber, says, “In prison, he can’t protect himself and he can’t social distance. My deep fear is that my dad will die in prison. That is a...n awful, traumatic reality to consider. My chest is tight just thinking about how quickly it spreads and how vulnerable he is.”

Governor Hickenlooper shortened his sentence following testimony from family, friends and correctional officers advocating for his early release. Yet, he is still eight years away from parole. While he remains in prison, COVID-19 continues to spread. Ronald’s three siblings, four children and four grandchildren are desperate for his release.

See More

entry.title: TOMORROW: Take action and tell Governor Polis to safely release...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

TOMORROW: Take action and tell Governor Polis to safely release the sick and elderly from Colorado’s prisons and stop the spread of COVID-19. He must use his executive authority to bring our neighbors home safely or more people will die, both behind bars and in the community.

entry.title: "Gov. Polis has said 'Black Lives Matter' — now...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

"Gov. Polis has said 'Black Lives Matter' — now we ask him to show us he means it by taking action to protect Black lives behind bars," wrote Dr. Apryl Alexander.

Tell Governor Polis that true solidarity means using his powers to save lives.

Black people living behind bars face a racist double whammy – because of their blackness they are more likely to be imprisoned, more likely to get COVID, and more likely to die from the virus.

denverpost.com

Guest commentary: If Black lives matter to him, Polis needs to reduce prison population

Black people living behind bars face a racist double whammy – because of their blackness they are more likely to be imprisoned, more likely to get COVID, and more likely to die from the virus.Black people living behind bars face a racist double whammy – because of their blackness they are more likely to be imprisoned, more likely to get COVID, and more likely to die from the virus.

entry.title: Did you know that deportation proceedings are one of the only...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Did you know that deportation proceedings are one of the only court cases in the country where a respondent doesn’t automatically have the right to a public defender? And, people are 10 times more likely to succeed in their immigration case when they have representation?

The Denver Legal Defense fund was created to help provide legal services to those facing deportation. On August 25th, the Vera Institute will be joined by RMIAN, the Denver Foundation, and Mayor Hancock to celebrate and raise awareness for the fund — which is critical during times of uncertainty.

RSVP here ⬇️.

TUE, AUG 25

Celebrate the Denver Immigrant Legal Defense Fund

Online EventCauses

entry.title: On 8/26, join families of vulnerable incarcerated Coloradans for...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

On 8/26, join families of vulnerable incarcerated Coloradans for a virtual panel on the need to release at-risk people from prison. Learn from our six inspiring panelists and take action to bring our at-risk neighbors safely home! RSVP at http://bit.ly/3iPuRMB or in the event below.

Our panelists include:
Amber Johnson, whose 62-year-old father, Ronald, has turned his life around in prison after being convicted of non-violent offenses related to substance abuse.

...

Will Cranfill, whose incarcerated father, James, is a 62-year-old grandfather, artist and Navy veteran who suffers from chronic inflammatory lung disease, a condition that puts him at grave risk of serious illness and death from COVID-19.

Sandra Winston, whose husband, Gary, is a 58-year-old grandfather with severe respiratory problems serving a one-year sentence for drug possession at Sterling, the site of Colorado’s largest COVID-19 outbreak.

Hassan Latif is the Executive Director and Founder of the Second Chance Center, where he works with justice involved men and women to lead lives of success and fulfillment. The Second Chance Center offers case management, mentoring, and vital resources to assist formerly incarcerated individuals in reestablishing their lives and becoming successful members of the community.

Erica Grossman is a partner in the law firm of Holland, Holland Edwards & Grossman. Erica has litigated a number of cases involving police brutality, unconstitutional jail conditions, first amendment issues, discrimination, and retaliation. She is the ACLU-CO’s cooperating counsel in the lawsuit against the Colorado Department of Corrections and the Governor for their failure to protect our vulnerable, incarcerated neighbors from COVID-19.

Gail Johnson has more than two decades of experience representing clients in criminal and civil cases in federal and state courts in Colorado, California, and the District of Columbia. You can read about several of Gail’s clients incarcerated in CDOC with serious underlying medical conditions, including Demika Rogers, Chris Nye and Gary Winston, at https://aclu-co.org/no-one-deserves-to-die-from-covid-19/

See More

WED, AUG 26

Covid-19 Decarceration Panel

Online EventCauses · 159 people

entry.title: Even during a pandemic, with fewer people traveling outside...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Even during a pandemic, with fewer people traveling outside their homes, fatal shootings by police in Colorado have become an epidemic. We are one of 7 states in the nation where fatal police shootings are higher than the past five years on average.

In 2020, police have killed 27 people in Colorado. From 2014–2019 police killed 189 people in Colorado — the 5th highest rate for fatal police shootings in the nation.

Of the 100 largest cities in America, Aurora is ranked 8th in ...the country for police killings. Denver is ranked 16th. It's time to transform policing in Colorado by dramatically reducing police departments’ responsibilities, power and funding.

READ THE REPORT: https://www.aclu.org/…/other-epidemic-fatal-police-shooting…

See More
